body:
Not sure what you mean, soft assertions shows a report of all failed assertions.
Can you give a test example ?
closing the issue for lack of feedback.

I agree with @christophsturm since I have the same need.

Let's take the example of [SoftAssertionsTest.should_be_able_to_catch_exceptions_thrown_by_all_proxied_methods()](https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/blob/b5e448af3b363526f25633005608a912ba51bdb2/src/test/java/org/assertj/core/api/SoftAssertionsTest.java#L109).

At [line 111](https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/blob/b5e448af3b363526f25633005608a912ba51bdb2/src/test/java/org/assertj/core/api/SoftAssertionsTest.java#L111)

``` java
softly.assertThat(BigDecimal.ZERO).isEqualTo(BigDecimal.ONE);
```

should trigger an error message containing

``` java
at org.assertj.core.api.SoftAssertionsTest:111
```

So, [line 210](https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/blob/b5e448af3b363526f25633005608a912ba51bdb2/src/test/java/org/assertj/core/api/SoftAssertionsTest.java#L210)

``` java
assertThat(errors.get(0)).isEqualTo("expected:<[1]> but was:<[0]>");
```

would become

``` java
assertThat(errors.get(0)).isEqualTo("expected:<[1]> but was:<[0]> (at org.assertj.core.api.SoftAssertionsTest:111)");
```
That would be an improvement indeed, I prefer the line number over the stack trace to keep the report readable.

issue.body:
Fixes #

…es #492)

A problem is writing a unit test. Because assertj removes it internal lines from stacktraces the feature does not work when the test is added to org.assertj.core.api.SoftAssertionsTest.
